>He pauses, his voice breathy, and face a bit flush. A deep breath, hand pressed against his chest.
Sounds a bit like our boy found one of his own The Preciouses.

Or one of the library books was open to a particularly lascivious page and he's easily flustered. But I'd wager the former.

> Suggest investigating this room.
Even if it's just a library, there's bound to be something noteworthy about the cathedral lying around that Ayla might be able to make heads or tails of. Like what the hell Kjorikos might be.

>>37766986
Also something like this. C'mon, kid. We gotta at least be on the same page. We claimed a gem as loot earlier, and people were a bit disgruntled but ultimately okay with it. The only thing that's gonna get people on the warpath is trying to bogart that shit.
